author: The Current
description:
Singer-songwriter Kathleen Edwards talks about working with Dan Wilson
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

The day after playing a show at the Fine Line in Minneapolis, Canadian singer-songwriter Kathleen Edwards visited The Current for a funny and heartfelt conversation with Morning Show host Jill Riley.

Edwards talked about her new record, "Billionaire" — including some Minnesota connections — like working with Minnesota-born songwriter on the album's title track. 

Watch and listen to the interview above.

Credits
Guest – Kathleen Edwards
Host – Jill Riley
Producer – Nilufer Arsala
Video – Erik Stromstad, Luke Taylor
Audio – Nilufer Arsala
Digital Producers – Reed Fischer, Luke Taylor

title: Kathleen Edwards talks about working with Dan Wilson on the title track to "Billionaire"

author: The Current
description:
Jill Riley from The Current’s Morning Show spoke with longtime Prince collaborators Morris Hayes and Bobby Z about the Purple Rain musical and its aspirations to push Prince's legacy forward.

Purple Rain's pre-Broadway run at the State Theatre in Minneapolis goes through Sunday, Nov. 23.
title: Morris Hayes on Prince and the Purple Rain musical #prince #purplerain #shorts

author: The Current
description:
Singer-songwriter Kathleen Edwards talks about 'Billlionaire' and more
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

The day after playing a show at the Fine Line in Minneapolis, Canadian singer-songwriter Kathleen Edwards visited The Current for a funny and heartfelt conversation with Morning Show host Jill Riley.

Edwards talked about her new record, Billionaire — including some Minnesota connections — and she also spoke about why she's decided to start playing early shows. "Who says I have to go on at nine or 10 o'clock at night? Nobody!” Edwards says. “So let's not do it."

Watch and listen to the interview above.

Credits
Guest – Kathleen Edwards
Host – Jill Riley
Producer – Nilufer Arsala
Video – Erik Stromstad, Luke Taylor
Audio – Nilufer Arsala
Digital Producers – Reed Fischer, Luke Taylor

author: The Current
description:
To celebrate The Current’s 20th Anniversary, The Current’s Live Sessions Vault unlocks never-before-seen live performance videos of bands and artists who have played in our iconic studio. 

Watch to see the full session of Laura Marling featuring previously unreleased footage, from when she visited The Current studio back in 2015.

Songs Performed 
00:00:00 Night After Night
00:03:02 For the Sake of the Song
00:06:37 How Can I

Musicians
Laura Marling — vocals, guitar

Credits
Engineer – Michael DeMark
Producer – Derrick Stevens
Visuals  – Leah Garaas
Digital Producer – Natalia Toledo
Graphics – Natalia Toledo

The Current’s Live Sessions Vault is supported by the Minnesota Orchestra, GS Motors, and Delta Dental of Minnesota Foundation.
